description_txt: stated on March 16, 2013 in a speech at CPAC:
quote_txt: "We have a federal government that thinks they have the authority to regulate our toilet seats."

description_txt: stated on March 19, 2013 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: "In the last two years, we have reduced the deficit by $2.5 trillion."

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2013 in remarks at a Washington, D.C. event.:
quote_txt: Says Houston is "home to more doctors, more nurses, more researchers than any other place in the world."

description_txt: stated on March 6, 2013 in a keynote speech to a commercial real estate group:
quote_txt: Said the year before he took office, the state lost 119,000 private-sector jobs, labeling them "Corzine jobs losses of 2009."

description_txt: stated on March 5, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says bag litter increased after San Francisco banned single-use shopping bags.

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2013 in a speech at CPAC:
quote_txt: "Scientists tell us that we could have a cure in 10 years for Alzheimer's" were it not for "overzealous regulators, excessive taxation and greedy litigators."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2013 in a speech at CPAC:
quote_txt: "Seven of the 10 highest-income counties in the country ring the city" of Washington D.C.

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2013 in a news release:
quote_txt: Wall Street megabanks that received bailouts in 2009 now get taxpayer-funded advantages not available to community banks in Ohio.

description_txt: stated on February 27, 2013 in House debate:
quote_txt: Says Virginia, Florida and Georgia are the three states that are the principal source for gun trafficking.

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2013 in a guest column:
quote_txt: Says we will pay the new chancellor "a basic salary of nearly $300,000 a year ... an amount that does not include the costs of this public employee’s benefits, perks and living expenses for a lavish house, an upscale car, a spending allowance, and fine dining almost every day on the taxpayer dollar."

description_txt: stated on March 17, 2013 in an appearance on NBC's 'Meet the Press':
quote_txt: "In the United States, 50 percent of social services are provided by the Catholic church."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2013 in a speech at the conservative CPAC conference:
quote_txt: Of every "three dollars in food stamps for the needy, seven dollars in salaries and pensions (go to) the bureaucrats who are supposed to be taking care of the poor."

description_txt: stated on March 13, 2013 in a committee hearing on HB 13:
quote_txt: "Nearly 25 percent of all automobile accidents are caused by texting while driving."

description_txt: stated on February 27, 2013 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: U.S. Rep. Scott Rigell "wants gun owners in a federal registration system."

description_txt: stated on March 6, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: "The incidents of threats against (President Barack Obama) are greater than for any other president in modern times."

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2013 in a column:
quote_txt: "Taxes and fees amount to about 20 percent of a typical $300 round-trip domestic ticket. That’s higher than taxes on products like alcohol, tobacco and firearms."

description_txt: stated on March 2, 2013 in an op-ed column on NJ.com:
quote_txt: "DEP has 2,812 employees, the lowest level since the mid-’80s."

description_txt: stated on March 5, 2013 in a lawsuit:
quote_txt: "There is no clinical evidence that vaccinating healthcare workers protects patients."

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2013 in a legislative hearing :
quote_txt: Says indoor workers get "less UV than outdoor workers, but they get more melanomas."

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2013 in a news release:
quote_txt: "In the period from 2007 to 2011, the Office of Health Insurance Commissioner reported an 18 percent decline in the state’s total medical spending."

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2013 in testimony before the R.I. House Oversight Committee:
quote_txt: Rhode Island is the last state still using the Optech III P voting machines and they don’t meet suggested federal standards.

description_txt: stated on March 15, 2013 in a speech at CPAC:
quote_txt: "Our debt is already bigger than our economy."

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2013 in a CPAC speech:
quote_txt: "The Chinese government provides their people no access to the Internet."

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2013 in a speech at the CPAC conference:
quote_txt: Says the federal government is supporting a study in Hawaii to "develop a menu for when we colonize Mars."

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2013 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says president is ‘spending $2.2 billion to give away "ObamaPhones." ’

description_txt: stated on March 3, 2013 in a website post.:
quote_txt: The transportation package passed by the General Assembly would impose the "largest tax increase in Virginia’s history."

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: Eighty-five percent of Floridians who will benefit from expanding Medicaid are "single, childless adults."

description_txt: stated on March 3, 2013 in an interview:

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2013 in an editorial:
quote_txt: Cobb is one of the largest school systems (in the nation) that is debt free.

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2013 in a speech at the conservative CPAC conference:
